channel.title: Comments on: Getting the client filename before using cffile
channel.description: Web development notes and commentary from Ryan Stille

item.title: By: Mark
item.dc:creator: Mark
item.description: Thanks so much!!! I've been trying to find a way to detect if a file was uploaded with a '?' in the file name (which causes the cffile tag to error), and this is it! Now I can detect the question mark and modify the file save path to remove the question marks on a windows server!
item.content:encoded: Thanks so much!!! I’ve been trying to find a way to detect if a file was uploaded with a ‘?’ in the file name (which causes the cffile tag to error), and this is it! Now I can detect the question mark and modify the file save path to remove the question marks on a windows server!

item.title: By: Jake Churchill
item.dc:creator: Jake Churchill
item.description: This is awesome. I gotta remember to try this.
item.content:encoded: This is awesome. I gotta remember to try this.

item.title: By: Tim Leach
item.dc:creator: Tim Leach
item.description: This is an awesome tip. Feels so much cleaner than the typical upload check delete, especially when trying to make your file uploads secure.
item.content:encoded: This is an awesome tip. Feels so much cleaner than the typical upload check delete, especially when trying to make your file uploads secure.
